org.spongepowered.api.block.tileentity

Interface TileEntity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CompositeValueStore<DataHolder,DataManipulator<?,?>>, DataHolder, DataSerializable, ValueContainer<DataHolder>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Banner, Beacon, BrewingStand, Chest, CommandBlock, Comparator, DaylightDetector, Dispenser, Dropper, EnchantmentTable, EnderChest, EndPortal, FlowerPot, Furnace, Hopper, Jukebox, MobSpawner, Note, Piston, Sign, Skull, TileEntityCarrier

    public interface TileEntity
extends DataHolder, DataSerializable
    Represents an abstract Tile Entity. It is a functional block that is continuously updated while residing in a world. It can perform specific functions based on the data that it contains.

    A TileEntity is contained within a Location and will continue to exists so long as the Location is of the correct block type.

    Since a TileEntity is performing various actions, all methods that are purely functional methods reside in the TileEntity, whereas customizable data associated with a TileEntity is represented by DataManipulator.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Checks for whether the tile entity is currently valid or not.

        Use this method to check if processing should be run on this TileEntity. If it is valid, then processing can be run on it. If not, then processing should wait until it becomes valid or is destroyed.

        Returns:
        True if the tile entity is valid, false if not

      • setValid

        void setValid(boolean valid)
        Changes the validation of this tile entity.

        If the tile entity is invalid, no processing will be done on this TileEntity until it either becomes valid or is reset on the next tick.

        If the tile entity is valid, then processing can continue and this TileEntity will not be reset on the next tick.

        Parameters:
        valid - True if the tile entity should be validated, or false if it should be invalidated

      • getType

        TileEntityType getType()
        Gets the type of TileEntity this is.
        Returns:
        The type of tile entity

      • getLocation

        Location<World> getLocation()
        Gets the Location that this TileEntity resides at.

        If the Location's BlockType is changed, this TileEntity may be removed as a consequence.

        Returns:
        The location

      • getBlock

        BlockState getBlock()
        Gets the BlockState that this TileEntity represents.
        Returns:
        The blockstate

      • getData

        Optional<? extends DataManipulator<?,?>> getData()
        Gets a copy of the underlying data of this TileEntity or Optional.absent() if none available.
        Returns:
        The data, if available
